posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Alright, this is for the people (like myself) that want to play an archer that is different from the standard AA's combos. I don't claim that this is as powerful as a well -build AA, nothing is, but it will do the job handily if you show him some trust. Moreover he is probably an icon since form tales/ folklore we all know Rangers to be synonymous with the word "Archer" more than anything else. Anyway, a few words for the build, one of the strong points of this combo is that we have uncanny dodge, so he will keep his vast majority of AC even when caught flat-footed. Moreover his damage is good, really good in fact, since he stacks Bane Of Enemies with EWS from the Fighter class and with 9 FE's he is pretty much guaranteed to have his BoE bonus everywhere that matters. Ranger spells like freedom, cat's grace, protection from elements and ultravision are all nice and useful and his animal companion is a welcome addition to his arsenal of weapons. He has also evasion, can spot, disarm and set all deadly traps, open most locks/ gates, use almost anything through umd and be stealthy like a shadow. I played him till level 36, or so and he felt good. He didn't outperform my arcane archer but he certainly felt more fun to my eyes.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Some omitted disclosure that may be useful...

AB, ranged, base: 30 BAB + 12 Dex + 1 Prowess + 1 WF + 2 EWF = +46/+41/+36/+31 (disregarding PBS range, FE)
AB, melee, base (any finessable): 30 BAB + 12 Dex + 1 Prowess = +43/+38/+33/+28 (1H), +41/+36/+31/+26/+41/+36 (DW)

XP Penalty: -20% at Level 24 (1 level), then -40% from 25 to 40 (total of 16)... which is probably why you won't see builds like this in many environments except those where the level cap is relatively easy to reach and then play forward as a maxed toon, despite the build's obvious strengths.

UMD 34(33) will allow all scrolls to be cast with 100% success.  UMD 31(30) only provides that amount of reliability for level 6 scrolls and below.  There are enough non-essential skill ranks to spare those 3 for the added casting/buffing potential.

posts.content: Going Human with this build would help a lot to alleviate the exp penalty from this build and even give it more skill points & hit points all at the cost of 1 AB, but blame it on the classic picture of Legolas that went this way ;)
